title: Graph of horizontal velocity of projectile

content.description: A ball is struck at time t = 0 and follows the parabolic path shown in the diagram above. The following graphs show quantities possibly associated with the motion as a function of time t. Assume that air resistance is negligible and that the positive directions are upward and to the right.
content.question: Which graph represents the horizontal component of the velocity of the ball?

choices.label: Choice A is a graph in the first quadrant with t on the horizontal axis. Choice A shows a line that starts at the origin increasing linearly, then halfway along the horizontal axis becomes linearly decreasing, returning to the horizontal axis.

Choice B is a graph in the first quadrant with t on the horizontal axis. Choice B shows a line that starts on the vertical axis above the origin decreasing linearly, reaches the horizontal axis, and then becomes linearly increasing.

Choice C is a graph in the first quadrant with t on the horizontal axis. Choice C shows a straight line that starts on the vertical axis below the origin and increases linearly, crossing the horizontal axis near the center.

Choice D is a graph in the first quadrant with t on the horizontal axis. Choice D shows a straight line that starts on the vertical axis above the origin and decreases linearly, crossing the horizontal axis near the center.
Choice E is a graph in the first quadrant with t on the horizontal axis. Choice E shows a horizontal line starting at a point on the vertical axis above the origin. u2028

content.answer: Choice E is a graph in the first quadrant with t on the horizontal axis. Choice E shows a horizontal line starting at a point on the vertical axis above the origin. u2028

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
